content: This is just one of those moments of curiosity. I read a lot of stuff on this site, but can't possibly keep up with the volume that many post here. Personnally, I post here when I feel strongly about a topic or feel compelled to dispell some things being discussed. I read a lot without comment. There is no way I could possibly find the time to keep up with many of you as far as number of posts. The time I spend posting is usually between lab tests and reports at work when it is not enough time for a new project and too much time to spend doing nothing. At home, kinda the same thing. If anyone else is willing to share, how do you come by the time to post here, for some, in a very large volume?
reply: This is just one of those moments of curiosity. I read a lot of stuff on this site, but can't possibly keep up with the volume that many post here. Personnally, I post here when I feel strongly about a topic or feel compelled to dispell some things being discussed. I read a lot without comment. There is no way I could possibly find the time to keep up with many of you as far as number of posts. The time I spend posting is usually between lab tests and reports at work when it is not enough time for a new project and too much time to spend doing nothing. At home, kinda the same thing. If anyone else is willing to share, how do you come by the time to post here, for some, in a very large volume?
title: Finding the time to post

content: I'm retired and partally disabled. I do computer work, much of which I can do by accessing my customers computers from here. I just keep this and several other forums running and pop in or out while waiting for things to load and so on. How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?
reply: I'm retired and partally disabled. I do computer work, much of which I can do by accessing my customers computers from here. I just keep this and several other forums running and pop in or out while waiting for things to load and so on. title: Finding the time to post

content: Same same GI. I’m retired but something is always going on. The gym 4 to 5 days a week Sharon has a lot of Honey do’s in fact I just got out from under the house putting in more braces between the floor joice, didn’t really need them just something to do. One of my LT’s, 2/6 (Mike)from VN just called and said he would be here April 10th for a few days if that was OK and I said come on so I’ll be busy that week. Chickens, ducks, bee’s, always something but that’s better than nothing. Actually I post more than I have time but I guess I’m just too opinionated not to get involved, I do miss a lot of post however.
reply: Same same GI. I’m retired but something is always going on. content: I am retired. I have no life. Mil.Com and its members are my family. Some of my family are like father and mother to me. Some are just plain brats. But still they are my family. I also hate most other people on the outside world. I hate my state politicians and I hate the Federal Gov't and their politicians. I spend about two hours a day on my computer. I wish there were more educated people like Nova Marine and Outlaws93 on board but hey what can one do? If it wasn't for watching Fox news I'd spend many more hours on the computer.

content: Retired. But, I'm busier now than when I worked, so I have to make time to come here. However, that's easier for me than it is for you because I don't HAVE to be anywhere at any time doing anything I don't want to do. Most of what I do now is volunteer work and, as I like to tell my fellow volunteers, I can volunteer out just as easily as I volunteered in. Then again, I'm a moderator and have, like, a job to do. (shudder....I hate that 3 letter word!)

title: Finding the time to post

content: My story is so sad, with no talents, trades, or skills There's nothing to do but mope around the house and watch my wife do all the work. After all, my grandmother would always say that man works from sun to sun, but woman's work was never done. Without skills the work is long gone, lucky me! One highlight of the day is airing up the flat tire on the car. Told her not to go off the road. Could go fishing with an AK 47 but without a fishing license they just wouldn't understand. Watching lemons fall off the lemon tree is thrill, like watching the grass grow. So I guess watching ghost stories on the Discovery Station with popcorn and soda is what I do best. And, if I should ever become a ghost, a happy ghost I shall be with more time to post.
reply: My story is so sad, with no talents, trades, or skills There's nothing to do but mope around the house and watch my wife do all the work. After all, my grandmother would always say that man works from sun to sun, but woman's work was never done. Without skills the work is long gone, lucky me! One highlight of the day is airing up the flat tire on the car. Told her not to go off the road. Could go fishing with an AK 47 but without a fishing license they just wouldn't understand. Watching lemons fall off the lemon tree is thrill, like watching the grass grow. So I guess watching ghost stories on the Discovery Station with popcorn and soda is what I do best. And, if I should ever become a ghost, a happy ghost I shall be with more time to post.

title: Finding the time to post

content: I'm kind of embarrased to to tell everyone that I am not retired but still working, but only 30 hours a week. I sold my pharmacy about a year and a half ago then was offered a job working with some guys I went to pharmacy school with in a new store they had opened. It can be a slow process to build your script volume from scratch so there can be some slow periods at times . Not to mention it is a rural area of the county. So when it is slow this is one of the things I do. Also in the evening if we are watching tv I'll get on my laptop and do both. Unlike most of the people who post here , I only did one hitch a while ago, and have been a civie ever since. With spring coming , I will probable be online less.
reply: I'm kind of embarrased to to tell everyone that I am not retired but still working, but only 30 hours a week. I sold my pharmacy about a year and a half ago then was offered a job working with some guys I went to pharmacy school with in a new store they had opened. It can be a slow process to build your script volume from scratch so there can be some slow periods at times . Not to mention it is a rural area of the county. So when it is slow this is one of the things I do. Also in the evening if we are watching tv I'll get on my laptop and do both. Unlike most of the people who post here , I only did one hitch a while ago, and have been a civie ever since. With spring coming , I will probable be online less.
